name: TriageNinja - Auto-Triage New Tickets
description: Automatically triage new tickets using Rovo Agent when they are created

trigger.description: Triggers when a new issue is created

actions.prompt:
Analyze this ticket and provide triage recommendations.

Use the following actions to gather information:
1. analyze-ticket-classification - Get ticket details and context
2. suggest-ticket-assignee - Get available agents and workload
3. find-similar-tickets - Find similar resolved tickets

Based on the analysis, provide:
- Category and subcategory
- Priority (High/Medium/Low)
- Urgency (Urgent/Normal)
- Suggested assignee with reasoning
- Confidence score (0-100)

Return results in JSON format:
{
  "category": "string",
  "subCategory": "string",
  "priority": "High|Medium|Low",
  "urgency": "Urgent|Normal",
  "assignee": {
    "accountId": "string",
    "displayName": "string",
    "reasoning": "string"
  },
  "confidence": number,
  "tags": ["string"]
}
actions.description: Invoke Rovo Agent to analyze the ticket
Update issue fields based on Rovo Agent recommendations

notes: This is a template configuration. Actual implementation requires Jira Automation UI.
Smart value paths (e.g., {{rovoOutput.assignee.accountId}}) may vary based on your Rovo Agent integration.
After creating the rule, check the Audit log to verify correct smart value paths.
Adjust issue types in conditions based on your project's needs.
Priority mapping may need adjustment based on your Jira priority scheme.
